title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the spatial pattern shown in Image 1 resulted from the long lot survey method.

Two points for describing how the long lot survey method resulted in the spatial pattern shown in Image 1.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the land survey method that resulted in the spatial pattern shown in Image 1 using one of the following :

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the land survey method used in Oxfordshire was a useful historical method.

Two points for describing a specific advantage of the metes and bounds survey method.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that French or European colonists brought the land survey method shown in Image 1 to the St. Lawrence River.

Two points for explaining the process of diffusion by which French or European colonists brought the long lot survey method shown in Image 1 to the St. Lawrence River.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following processes of diffusion by which the land survey method shown in Image 1 arrived in the St. Lawrence River valley:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that much of the land in Oxfordshire will likely continue to be used for small farms.

Two points for explaining a specific reason why much of the land in Oxfordshire will likely continue to be used for small farms.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that local-food movements in Oxfordshire may affect patterns of land use in this area:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that local-food movements in Oxfordshire may affect patterns of land use in this area:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that that the details of rural land use patterns would be more difficult to interpret at the 1:1,000,000 scale.

Two points for explaining in terms of map scale and/or map extent that it would be more difficult to interpret rural land use patterns at the 1:1,000,000 scale.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following disadvantages of changing the scale of these images to 1:1,000,000 for interpreting rural land use patterns:
The response correctly explains one of the following disadvantages of changing the scale of these images to 1:1,000,000 for interpreting rural land use patterns:
